meanings.definition: A doctrine that identifies God with the universe.
meanings.sent1: Pantheism teaches that God is the same as the whole universe.
meanings.sent2: Many ancient cultures embraced pantheism, seeing divinity in all things.
meanings.sent3: The idea of pantheism can make you appreciate the beauty of nature even more.
meanings.sent4: In pantheism, the universe is like a grand tapestry woven with threads of divinity.
meanings.sent5: Pantheism paints a picture of a universe infused with the essence of God.

meanings.definition: The belief that God is immanent in nature and the universe.
meanings.sent1: Pantheism suggests that God is present in every aspect of nature.
meanings.sent2: Some poets find inspiration in the concept of pantheism, seeing God in every leaf and breeze.
meanings.sent3: Imagine a world where pantheism is true, and every rock and tree whispers divine secrets.
meanings.sent4: To a pantheist, the world is a living, breathing manifestation of God's presence.
meanings.sent5: The philosophy of pantheism invites us to see the universe as a sacred sanctuary.
